title: The Writer's Almanac for Friday, March 4, 2022
description: Frances Perkins became the first female U.S. Secretary of Labor on this date in 1933. She led the elimination of Child Labor, the 40-hour workweek, and Social Security.
itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
itunes:subtitle: Frances Perkins became the first female U.S. Secretary of Labor on this date in 1933. She led the elimination of Child Labor, the 40-hour workweek, and Social Security.
